revised_title: Hydraulic Signals in Plants: Coordination of Physiological Responses
tldr: This article discusses the role of hydraulic signals in plants, which are self-propagating changes in water pressure that can coordinate physiological responses. The xylem system allows for rapid propagation of these signals throughout the plant, affecting stomatal aperture and potentially triggering systemic changes in surface electrical potential. Wound-induced hydraulic signals can also activate defense responses in plants.
